  • Method Details

    • read

      public <T> java.util.List<T> read​(QueryDetails details, java.lang.Class<T> tClass) throws java.lang.Exception
      Reads data from the database and serializes each row / document to a concrete class provided by T.
      Type Parameters:
      T - Type constraint ensures that the class provided must be a subclass of Entity.
      Parameters:
      details - Query details contain all the information relevant for a query (tablename, projection, etc.)
      tClass - Class type that the data fetched from the database should be serialized to
      Returns:
      A list of T objects (serialized from the data received from the database)
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Multiple exceptions may be thrown differing per database adapter.

    • create

      public <T extends Entity> int create​(QueryDetails details, T obj) throws java.lang.Exception
      Inserts 1 entity into the database. The information for the insert query is gatherd by calling obj.keyValuePairs. Any custom serialization of data should be done by overriding the method keyValuePairs(Class< ? extends Annotation > ...) in the class T.
      Type Parameters:
      T - Type constraint. An object that is to be inserted must extend Entity
      Parameters:
      details - Query details contain all the information relevant for a query (tablename, projection, etc.)
      obj - Object that should be inserted into the database.
      Returns:
      Number of rows (or documents) inserted
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Multiple exceptions may be thrown differing per database adapter.

    • update

      public <T extends Entity> int update​(QueryDetails details, T obj) throws java.lang.Exception
      Updates 1 entity in the database. The information for the update query is gathered by calling obj.keyValuePairs. Any custom serialization of data should be done by overriding the method keyValuePairs(Class< ? extends Annotation > ...) in the class T.
      Type Parameters:
      T - Type constraint. An object that is to be inserted must extend Entity
      Parameters:
      details - Query details contain all the information relevant for a query (tablename, projection, etc.)
      obj - Object that should be inserted into the database.
      Returns:
      Number of rows (or documents) affected by the update.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Multiple exceptions may be thrown differing per database adapter.

    • deleteOne

      public int deleteOne​(QueryDetails details) throws java.lang.Exception
      Deletes at most 1 entity in the database that matches the provided query information.
      Parameters:
      details - Query details contain all the information relevant for a query (tablename, projection, etc.)
      Returns:
      Number of rows (or documents) deleted.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Multiple exceptions may be thrown differing per database adapter.

    • deleteMany

      public int deleteMany​(QueryDetails details) throws java.lang.Exception
      Deletes all entities in the database that match the provided query information.
      Parameters:
      details - Query details contain all the information relevant for a query (tablename, projection, etc.)
      Returns:
      Number of rows (or documents) deleted.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Multiple exceptions may be thrown differing per database adapter.

    • connect

      public void connect​(ConnectionInfo info) throws java.lang.Exception
      Specified by:
      connect in interface DBAdapter
      Parameters:
      info - Connection information containing db name, db url, username, password, number of concurrent connections, etc.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Multiple exceptions may be thrown differing per database adapter.

    • queryFactory

      public <T extends QueryDetails> T queryFactory() throws java.lang.Exception
      Provides the correct QueryDetails instance for the adapter in use. See adapter specific QueryClasses in com.foodmobile.databaselib.adapters.
      Specified by:
      queryFactory in interface DBAdapter
      Type Parameters:
      T - Type constraint ensures the caller the returned object inherits QueryDetails.
      Returns:
      An instance of QueryDetails (different for each adapter).
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • create

      public <T extends Entity> int create​(QueryDetails details, java.util.List<T> obj) throws java.lang.Exception
      Inserts multiple entities into the database using the provided query information. Each obj is serialized by calling obj.keyValuePairs(...). To add custom serialization override this method in class T.
      Type Parameters:
      T - Type constraint. An object that is to be inserted must extend Entity
      Parameters:
      details - Query details contain all the information relevant for a query (tablename, projection, etc.)
      obj - Objects that should be inserted into the database.
      Returns:
      Number of rows (or documents) inserted
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Multiple exceptions may be thrown differing per database adapter.

    • update

      public <T extends Entity> int update​(QueryDetails details, java.util.List<T> obj) throws java.lang.Exception
      Updates multiple entities in the database using the query information provided. Each obj is serialized by calling obj.keyValuePairs(...). To add custom serialization override this method in class T.
      Type Parameters:
      T - Type constraint. An object that is to be inserted must extend Entity
      Parameters:
      details - Query details contain all the information relevant for a query (tablename, projection, etc.)
      obj - Objects that should be inserted into the database.
      Returns:
      Number of rows (or documents) affected by the update.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Multiple exceptions may be thrown differing per database adapter.

      java.lang.Exception
